Key Arguments: The legislation attacks free speech and expression.
Free speech is essential for a marketplace of ideas where truth prevails.
Good science relies on debate and opposing voices, not monopolization by political powers.
The bill exempts the government and mainstream media, creating a double standard.
Fact-checking operations have been problematic and reinforce narratives rather than truth.
The legislation is incomprehensible for a democratically elected government.
Notable Quotes: "The purpose of free speech...is to preserve an uninhibited marketplace of ideas in which truth will ultimately prevail, rather than to countenance monopolisation of the market, whether it be by government itself or private licensee."
If we are to remain a free country where the real truth, not ‘The Narrative’, should set us free, this bill must be rejected.
